Problem:
Consider a system represented by a complex function \\( z(t) = e^{i\\omega t} \\), where \\( i \\) is the imaginary unit and \\( \\omega \\) a constant frequency. We assess the effect of an integral transformation defined by \\( T[f](t) = \\int e^{-i\\omega s}f(s)ds \\) over an interval.

Can the original function \\( z(t) \\) be reconstructed uniquely from the transformed function \\( T[z](t) \\) at any time \\( t = T \\) without additional data or transformations?
Explanation: The transformation integral \\( T \\) effectively erases phase information about \\( z(t) \\) and incorporates the whole history of the function over an interval into a single result. As such, critical information about the exact state of \\( z(t) \\) at specific times is lost, preventing unique reconstruction of the original function just from \\( T[z](T) \\).
